question: An induced current of 2 A flows through a coil. The resistance of the coil is 10 <katex>$\Omega$</katex>. What is the change in magnetic flux associated with the coil in 1 ms?
explanation: The induced EMF is given by <katex>$\varepsilon = \frac{d\phi}{dt} = IR$</katex>.
The change in flux is <katex>$d\phi = IR dt = 2 \times 10 \times 10^{-3} = 20 \times 10^{-3} = 2 \times 10^{-2} \text{ Wb}$</katex>.
